cipher_text:
Encode the following text to a Caesar cipher. The shift is 3.
plain text: κάθε σύννεφο έχει μια ασημένια επένδυση
plain text in ascii: \u03ba\u03b1\u03b8\u03b7\u03b5\u03c4\u03b5\u03c1\u03b5\u03c4\u03b7\u03b5\u03c1 \u03b7\u03bf\u03c5\u03c4\u03b9\u03b2\u03b5\u03c4\u03b5\u03c1 \u03ea\u03b1\u03c5\u03b8\u03bd\u03b9\u03b5\u03c4\u03b5\u03c1
The Caesar cipher is a type of substitution cipher in which each letter in the plaintext is 'shifted' a certain number of places down the alphabet. In this case, the shift is 3.
To encrypt the given plain text using a Caesar cipher with a shift of 3, we need to replace each letter in the plain text with the letter three places down the alphabet. For example, the letter 'α' would be replaced with 'δ', and the letter 'β' would be replaced with 'ε'.
Here is the encrypted text:
\u03c4\u03b5\u03b8\u03b7\u03b5\u03c9\u03b5\u03c4\u03b5\u03c9\u03b7\u03b5\u03c4\u03b5\u03c1
